item.title: Elyse add a quote by Gary Paulsen
item.description: "Why do I read? I just can't help myself. I read to learn and to grow, to laugh and to be motivated. I read to understand things I've never been exposed to. I read when I'm crabby, when I've just said monumentally dumb things to the people I love. I read for strength to help me when I feel broken, discouraged, and afraid. I read when I'm angry at the whole world. I read when everything is going right. I read to find hope. I read because I'm made up not just of skin and bones, of sights, feelings, and a deep need for chocolate, but I'm also made up of words. Words describe my thoughts and what's hidden in my heart. Words are alive--when I've found a story that I love, I read it again and again, like playing a favorite song over and over. Reading isn't passive--I enter the story with the characters, breathe their air, feel their frustrations, scream at them to stop when they're about to do something stupid, cry with them, laugh with them. Reading for me, is spending time with a friend. A book is a friend. You can never have too many." -- Gary Paulsen

item.title: Elyse add a quote by David Grossman
item.description: "The primary urge that motivates and engenders writing...is the writer's desire to invent and tell a story, and to know himself. But the more I write, the more I feel the force of the other urge, which collaborates with and completes the first one: the desire to know the Other from within him. To feel what it means to be another person. To be able to touch, if only for a moment, the blaze that burns within another human being." -- David Grossman

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Salmon Rushdie
item.description: "Why do we care about singers? Wherein lies the power of songs? Maybe it derives from the sheer strangeness of there being singing in the world. The note, the scale, the chord; melodies, harmonies, arrangements; symphonies, ragas, chinese operas,jazz, the blues: that such things should exist, that we should have discovered the magical intervals and distances that yield the poor cluster of notes, all within the span of a human hand from which we can build our cathedrals of sound, is alchemical a mystery as mathematics, or wine, or love. Maybe the birds taught us. Maybe not. Maybe we are just creatures in search of exaltation. We don't have much of it. Our lives are not what we deserve; they are, let us agree, in many painful ways deficient. Song turns them into something else. Song shows us a world that is worthy of our yearning, it shows us our selves as they might be, if we were worthy of the world. " -- Salmon Rushdie

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Tatjana Soli
item.description: "Why did someone fall in love with you because you are one thing and then want you to be something else?" -- Tatjana Soli

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Mitchell Zuckoff
item.description: "Fear is something I don’t think you experience unless you have a choice. If you have a choice, then you’re liable to be afraid. But without a choice, what is there to be afraid of? You just go along doing what has to be done." -- Mitchell Zuckoff

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "It was strange the way he loved her; a side long and almost casual love, as if loving her were simply a matter of course, too natural to mention" -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Roland Merullo
item.description: "I felt I was drawing close to that age, that place in life, where you realize one day what you'd told yourself was a Zen detachment turns out to be naked fear. You'd had one serious love relationship in your life and it had ended in tragedy, and the tragedy had broken something inside you. But instead of trying to repair the broken place, or at least really stop and look at it, you skated and joked. You had friends, you were a decent citizen. You hurt no one. And your life was somehow just about half of what it could be." -- Roland Merullo

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Will Schwalbe
item.description: "We're all in the end-of-your-life book-club, whether we acknowledge it or not; each book we read may well be the last, each conversation the final one." -- Will Schwalbe

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Will Schwalbe
item.description: "Reading isn't the opposite of doing. It's the opposite of dying." -- Will Schwalbe

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Will Schwalbe
item.description: "One of the many things I love about bound books is their sheer physicality. Electronic books live out of sight and out of mind. But printed books have body, presence. ... I often seek electronic books, but they never come after me. They may make me feel, but I can't feel them. They are all soul with no flesh, no texture, and no weight." -- Will Schwalbe

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "The beginning is the word and the end is silence. And in between are all the stories." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "The secret of flight is this -- you have to do it immediately, before your body realizes it is defying the laws." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Elyse add a quote by William Kent Krueger
item.description: "I used to ask for an easy life, now I ask to be strong." -- William Kent Krueger

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jonathan Haidt
item.description: "Anyone who values truth should stop worshipping reason." -- Jonathan Haidt

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jojo Moyes
item.description: "Some mistakes... Just have greater consequences than others. But you don't have to let the result of one mistake be the thing that defines you. You, Clark, have the choice not to let that happen." -- Jojo Moyes

item.title: Elyse add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elyse add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jonathan Goldstein
item.description: "We want more than there is." -- Jonathan Goldstein

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jonathan Goldstein
item.description: "Everyone runs around trying to find a place where they still serve breakfast because eating breakfast, even if it's 5 o'clock in the afternoon, is a sign that the day has just begun and good things can still happen. Having lunch is like throwing in the towel." -- Jonathan Goldstein

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Michael Lavigne
item.description: "But secrets never, ever disappear, even after they are revealed. And that's the real secret right there. The empty space that never gets filled. The entropy of falsehood. The real secret is the secret itself." -- Michael Lavigne

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Jonathan Dee
item.description: "On the way home I was mugged and hit my head and got amnesia. I don't remember anything that happened before yesterday. I found your address in my wallet. I couldn't remember my name. I still can't. Let's go out and get new ones. My treat." -- Jonathan Dee

item.title: Elyse add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part." -- John Irving

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Gwyneth Paltrow
item.description: "Beauty, to me, is about being comfortable in your own skin. That, or a kick-ass red lipstick." -- Gwyneth Paltrow

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Gwyneth Paltrow
item.description: "The best way to mend a broken heart is time and girlfriends." -- Gwyneth Paltrow

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Andrew Kaufman
item.description: "- the only difference between a happy ending and a sad ending is where you decide the story ends." -- Andrew Kaufman

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Mark Slouka
item.description: "Consider it: Who but God could have dreamed a tale so absurd and so heartless?" -- Mark Slouka

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "This is why I read novels: so I can escape my own unrelenting monologue." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Elyse add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Happiness is the lucky pane of glass you carry in your head. It takes all your cunning just to hang on to it, and once it's smashed you have to move into a different sort of life." -- Carol Shields
